result.execSummary:
The defendant Winston J. Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

provide a DNA sample at the jail
Good time and credit from 8-12-15

Defendant Winston J. Peters in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Defendant Winston J. Peters in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire received.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of his rights.  Statement by ADA Niemi.  Victim information sent to victims and responses are not due back until 8/21.  Defense remarks by bond.  Response by Atty. Niemi.  Court modifies cash bond with conditions.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
No contact with Parkside Apartments at 725 S Main Street, except with law enforcement to remove belongings. No contact with EM, SH and CL. Picture and prints.
Defendant Winston J. Peters appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Catharine Denise White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.
